parallel.distributed
Class PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorClt

java.lang.Object
  parallel.distributed.PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorClt
public class PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorClt
extends java.lang.Object

class implements the "Client" for networks of PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorWrk workers attached to PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorSrv servers (managers really), as a Singleton. Connects to a host server represented by the PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorSrv object, to a specific host/port IP address, during first use, and remains connected to that server for the duration of its useful life; when the user-code no longer needs the client services, must invoke disconnect() method to free up client and server resources.

Title: popt4jlib

Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2016-2017

Company:

Version:
1.0
Author:
Ioannis T. Christou

submitWorkFromSameHost

public void submitWorkFromSameHost(TaskObject[] tasks)
                            throws java.io.IOException,
                                   java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                   PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorException
the main method of the class. Sends over the network the tasks parameter to the PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorSrv server who then distributes them to one of the available workers in the network. Method returns immediately.

Parameters:
tasks - TaskObject[]
Throws:
java.io.IOException
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorException
PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorNWAException - if no worker currently allows submissions

submitWorkFromSameHostInParallel

public void submitWorkFromSameHostInParallel(TaskObject[] tasks,
                                             int max_chunk_size)
                                      throws java.io.IOException,
                                             java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                             PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorException
the second main method of the class, works as the method submitWorkFromSameHost(), except that it breaks the tasks into chunks of the given size, and submits them one at a time. Method returns immediately.

Parameters:
tasks - TaskObject[]
max_chunk_size - int
Throws:
java.io.IOException
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorException
PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorNWAException - if no worker was available. Notice that in this case, there might be some tasks that were successfully submitted, while others failed to be submitted. In such a case, the tasks array is modified and has null elements for all those tasks that were successfully submitted

submitWork

public void submitWork(java.lang.String originating_client,
                       TaskObject[] tasks)
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                       PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorException
sends over the network the tasks parameter to the PDBatchTaskExecutorSrv server, who then distributes them to one of the available workers in the network. Method returns immediately.

Parameters:
originating_client - String <host>_<port> frmt
tasks - TaskObject[]
Throws:
java.io.IOException
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorException
PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorNWAException - when all workers are at full capacity, and cannot accept other tasks currently.

submitWork

public void submitWork(java.util.Vector originating_clients,
                       TaskObject[] tasks)
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                       PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorException
same method as submitWork(client, tasks) but carries all the names of the hosts that have submitted the tasks to various servers (only applies when there exists more than one server in the system of servers, clients and workers). Method returns immediately.

Parameters:
originating_clients - Vector // Vector<String>
tasks - TaskObject[]
Throws:
java.io.IOException
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorException
PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorNWAException - if no worker has capacity

sendInitCmd

public void sendInitCmd(PDAsynchInitCmd initcmd)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                        PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorException
send an init-cmd to forward to any worker connecting to the server. Method is synchronized to protect the output connection stream, returns as soon as the parameter object is written on the socket (does not wait for an OKReply or anything from the server). If it is called, it must be the first method called after object is constructed, and must be called only once.

Parameters:
initcmd - PDAsynchInitCmd
Throws:
java.io.IOException
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
PDAsynchBatchTaskExecutorException - if any other request has been issued from this client before.
